events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - May 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meet up time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: May 19th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Senthamil Selvan 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Nagaraj Venkatesan Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium Topic 1: Data Access & Storage Options in Universal Apps Synopsis: Managing data is a critical part of app development. Whether it’s a game, news, travel or fashion app, it’s always all about the data. I’ll discuss the various data storage options and data access APIs available for building Universal apps, as well as data management strategies for both content and configuration. Speaker Profile: Senthamil Selvan Senthamil Selvan is awarded as Microsoft MVP in Windows Development. He has 11+ years of experience in Microsoft Platform including Windows Forms, SharePoint and Universal Apps development. He has published several Windows Apps in the Store - 8 Windows Phone and 5 Windows Store Apps. Topic 2:  SQL Server 2016 - Real Time Operational Analytics - "Real" Game changer Synopsis: Performing analytics on operational data has all along being a huge challenge for applications, due to its impact on regular operations and day to day transactions. SQL Server 2016 has extended its analytic capablities by itsenhancements on "In memory tables" and Columnstore indexes.SQL Server 2016 columnstore index enhancements is a boon for performing analytics on operational data with no impact to regular workload, with no delayed data,no complex ETL tasks and without a need to maintain seperate data warehouse. The presentation would cover how "In Memory" Columnstore indexes help to perform real time operational analytics and would involve interesting demos show casing the gains using SQL Server 2016 "In Memory" and Disk Column Store Index enhancements. Speaker Profile: Nagaraj Venkatesan Nagaraj Venkatesan, a SQL Server enthusiast exploring SQL Server for the last 10 years. Working for NCS Pte Ltd as SQL Server DBA, Nagaraj maintains databases used by one of the busiest public facing applications in the city. He frequently blogs at strictlysql.blogspot.com and is a regular contributor sqlservercentral.com. Besides these, he also holds a Masters Degree in Computing from National University of Singapore
events.location: Microsoft Singpaore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorum, Singapore 018989

events.name: Humla Workshop -  The exploit research series - Part 2
events.description:
We are pleased to inform Humla Hands-On workshop on Exploit Research part  2 by Ravishanker Kusuma Please note, this event is a FREE hands-on workshop, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive email from humla champion by 16th May 2016. *** We are looking for more speakers to contribute to this series. Please get in touch if you are interested.  Selection Criteria: Selection (15-20 persons only) will be based on the following two criteria: 1. Contribution to the community. Speakers, humla, bachav champions, core team, volunteers  and venue hosts will get priority to the workshop.  2. Passion towards Information security + the attendance in previous meet ups.   If you are new to the community, selection will be based on the answers to the survey questions asked during the registration process. Please answer these questions carefully. Agenda:  Every day numerous software exploits are being disclosed, some openly and some via vendors. The Exploit research, series of workshops will cover how to identify software vulnerabilities, what techniques are used by attackers to exploit software flaws and how we can find and fix bugs before bad guys do.   The aim of these workshops is to teach participant about the following topics 1.  How to find security issues using static code analysis and fuzzing. 2.  Stack/SEH/Heap Overflows, egg hunting and custom shell code creation.   3.  ASLR Bypass and other security bypasses. 4.  Porting the exploits to Metasploit 5.  How to fix security issues. 


In the second part of this series, we will cover the following of exploit research, 1. How function calls are made in windows assembly. 2. Hello world windows shellcode. 3. How to create windows shellcode manually.  4. How to encode the shellcode manually.  


Pre-requisites: Basics of Assembly Language and should be comfortable working with command line.   Don’t know assembly? Watch these videos - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96AB65DFCE02EE3E  Who should attend ? :  Anyone who is interested in low level exploitation, reverse engineering and malware analysis. What should I bring with me? : Hardware: Laptop which can run two VMs simultaneously with at least 4 GB RAM and minimum 30 GB hard disk free space. Software:   VMware Player Installed with Windows Vista and Kali VM (32 bit). Immunity debugger (free version) installed on the windows Vista VM. You also need to install python for immunity. More instructions will be sent via email.  


Editor: Notepad++ (preferred) or any editor of your choice installed in windows VM ( VIM or emacs anyone ;) ) 


Null humla champion: Ravi is currently working at PayPal as part of the InfoSec team and has over a decade of experience with 12+ years of development experience. He can code in C,C++,iOS and has expertise in Web Security & iOS Security.  He also blogs at http://hayageek.com Please reach out to humla champion, if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: talk.js
events.description:
How well do you know your Functions? - Tim Oxley Highlights 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open mic announcements 9.00pm: End of event 


Scheduled talks - How well do you know your Functions? - Tim Oxley - Ambient Dynamix : JS and IoT - Shivam Verma  - es6+angular development - Krishna Murali - No fear - Chris Lienert - If you are interested in giving a talk, ping us on our Gitter channel! 


Misc If you have a short announcement you'd like to share with the audience, you may do so during open mic announcements. Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security. Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Design Innovation Dialogue
events.description: The Design Innovation Singapore community will come together every month to chat, socialise and have a dialogue about topics such as Human-centred Design, Design Thinking in different industries, Creativity in Teams and Innovation Practices in Organisations. We welcome all creatives, innovators, startup entrepreneurs, technologists, consultants, bankers, educators, policy makers and everyone interested in Design Innovation in Singapore. Come and meet an interdisciplinary group, make the right connections and build the Design Innovation community Singapore. See you from 7 pm.
events.location: Club Meatballs, 20 Cross Street, #01-34,China Square Central, Singapore

events.name: User Research - How to be an effective Usability Testing moderator
events.description:
A workshop for moderating well in Usability Testing. 

Agenda: • 30min: Pizza + Networking. • 15min: Mini-talk on Usability Testing • 40min: In pairs, role play as a moderator in usability testing • 20min: Reflection & Discussion • 5min: Wrapping up
events.location: Rakuten Crimson House, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: So You Want To Be A Developer?
events.description:
RSVP for free here: http://ga.co/1TunLcc

Speakers:
Laurence Putra (Software Engineer, Nugit)
Gabe Hollombe (Principal Software Engineer, Pivotal Labs Singapore)
David Zhu (Engineering Lead for NBU (Next Billion Users), Google)
Wei Lu (Software Engineer, Quantcast)

Moderator: Jeremiah Alexander (WDI Instructor, General Assembly Singapore)

With all the hype and buzz about Singapore's "Smart Nation" initiative, there seems to be an influx of demand for developers with both startups and corporates.

In this event, we will cover the steps that you need to take to become a developer, the expectations you can have throughout your career and key areas of growth within the industry.

Join us and get acquainted with the exciting developers' world in Singapore!
events.location: Google Singapore, 8 Marina View, Asia Square 1, Level 30 018960
